CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1952, pg. 22 reads: "W.C. Handy Plays "St. Louis Blues" Here - Sightless W.C. Handy, author of the famous "St. Louis Blues," played his own composition for the audience at the auditions of "Big Break of 1953," staged by the Greater Improvement League of Pittsburgh, at Schenley High School last Friday. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: W. C. Handy playing trumpet on stage, with woman and two men seated on armchairs in background
CatSubject_tab: Handy, W. C. (William Christopher), 1873-1958.Trumpets--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pianos--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Schenley High School (Pittsburgh, Pa.)
